document.heading: Prevention of Transmission of the Human Immunodeficiency Virus Temporary Amendment Act of 1995

history.narrative: Law 11-44, the “Prevention of Transmission of the Human Immunodeficiency Virus Temporary Amendment Act of 1995,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 11-311. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on June 6, 1995, and June 20, 1995, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on June 28, 1995, it was assigned Act No. 11-82 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 11-44 became effective on September 16, 1995.
